course.subject: MATH
course.name: Survival Analysis
course.description: The topics discussed in this course include basic quantities like hazard rate function, survival function, censoring and/or truncation; parametric estimation of the survival distribution by maximum likelihood estimation method; nonparametric estimation of the survival functions from possibly censored samples; parametric regression models; Cox's semi-parametric proportional hazards regression model; and multivariate survival analysis.

reviews.author: DKYL
reviews.title: Survival Analysis
reviews.comment_content:
Course Syllabus:
1.    Introduction to Survival Analysis
2.    Non-parametric methods for survival data
3.    Parametric methods for survival data
4.    Parameter Estimation with censored data
5.    Hypothesis Testing for parameters
6.    Survival Distribution Fitting
7.    Comparison of Survival Distributions
8.    Regression models for survival data

The course mainly teaches you how to model right-censored data in both non-parametric and parametric ways. R and its package for survival analysis will be used in the course. But don't expect you can learn R deeply in the course.

Similar to many other courses in Math Department, the course lacks of real-life application. The data used are not real-life data so they cannot give you any inspiration.

Most of the exam questions are computation. If you can understand how to use the equations, you can get a good result the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Colorful and beautiful notes. Attendance is important as you need to fill the missing parts in the notes which will be presented in the lecture.

I did not attend any of the tutorial classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 20%
Mid-term Exam: 30% (0%)
Final Exam: 50% (80%)

Both exams are open-book!!!
As usual, Dr. Yu is generous in giving grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is an assignment almost every week.
Assignment mainly consists of three types of questions:
1. Proof
2. Computation
3. Computation and plotting graphs by using R

Both exams are open-book so you do not need to memorize the equations but you need to know how to use them.

reviews.author: 數學研究生
reviews.title: Great course but it's really difficult
reviews.comment_content:
This is a small class. In this semester, there are only 15 people join this course and I don't know why.

Content:
Definitions you have to know:
1. Censored data and Uncensored data
2. Survival Probability and Hazard Rate
3. KM Estimation and NA Estimation
4. Parametric Distribution and Non-parametric Distribution
5. Testing: MME, MLE, ...
6. Grouped data and or ungrouped data
7. Models'

Actually, there are totally eight chapters and the difficulty is increasing.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Yu explains ideas and gives examples to make sure students understand the concepts. Of course, materials are related to the software R. Therefore, he also teaches coding in class.

Dr. Yu is kind to answer any questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 4 to 5 assignments needed to hand in.
There are totally eight chapters but some of the questions are quite straight forward so they were skipped and you can do it by yourself.

There are two grading methods, and Dr.Yu will take the maximum one.
A. HW (20%), Midterm (30%), Final Exam (50%)
B. HW(20%), Midterm (0%), Final Exam (80%)

So, if once you cannot get a good result in midterm, you can work hard in the final.

Graded by curve so good luck.
reviews.comment_workload: An assignment two weeks, quite light.
